es.csic.iiia.nsm.config
Interface NormSynthesisSettings

public interface NormSynthesisSettings

Basic settings of the Norm Synthesis Machine. In particular, this class contains all the norm synthesis settings that are not domain-dependent. For instance, the default utility of norms, or the number of ticks of stability for the NSM to converge.

Author:
"Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"

getNormsDefaultUtility

float getNormsDefaultUtility()
The default utility when norms are created. Typically, it is set to 0.5

Returns:
the default norms' utility

getNormEvaluationLearningRate

float getNormEvaluationLearningRate()
The learning rate (alpha) to compute rewards for norm evaluation. Typically, it is set to 0.1 or 0.2

Returns:
the norm evaluation learning rate (alpha parameter)

getGeneralisationBoundary

float getGeneralisationBoundary(Dimension dim,
                                Goal goal)
Returns the boundary under which a norm's utility is considered low enough to specialise the norm

Parameters:
dim - the dimension of the utility (effectiveness/necessity)
goal - the system goal of the utility
Returns:
the specialisation boundary
See Also:
Dimension, Goal, NormGroupUtility

getSpecialisationBoundary

float getSpecialisationBoundary(Dimension dim,
                                Goal goal)
Returns the boundary over which a norm's utility is considered high enough to be generalised with other norms

Parameters:
dim - the dimension of the utility (effectiveness/necessity)
goal - the goal of the utility
Returns:
the generalisation boundary
See Also:
Dimension, Goal, NormGroupUtility

getNumTicksOfStabilityForConvergence

long getNumTicksOfStabilityForConvergence()
Returns the number of ticks to consider that the norm synthesis machine has converged to a normative system. It is considered to have converged whenever, during N ticks: (1) the system remains with no conflicts; and (2) the normative system remains without changes.

Returns:
the number of ticks of stability
